IP_SYN_2_style_6: Under general anesthesia a left-sided double-lumen endotracheal tube was placed and isolation was confirmed bronchoscopically. The patient was positioned and 1 liter of warm saline was instilled into the left lung followed by chest percussion and drainage. This cycle was repeated until 8 liters had been instilled and the effluent cleared of sediment. The procedure was terminated and the patient was extubated and transferred to the ICU for observation of hypoxia.
